EmailTemplate.subject: Thank You for Joining Pivotal at ApacheCon and Welcome Apache Geode!
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{lead.First Name:default=There}},
Pivotal had a lot going on this year as a Platinum sponsor at ApacheCon. In addition to several excellent sessions, Pivotal also debuted Apache Geode <http://pivotal.io/big-data/press-release/pivotal-releases-geode> (now incubating) â€“ the new in-memory distributed database that will form the open source core of Pivotal GemFire <http://pivotal.io/big-data/pivotal-gemfire>.
Pivotal is looking for supporters for the Apache Geode technology and community. Check out this blog <http://blog.pivotal.io/big-data-pivotal/news-2/become-a-founding-contributor-of-project-geode> for information on how to get involved.
For additional opportunities to support the effort:
- Visit the Apache Geode page <http://geode.incubator.apache.org/> - Participate in the Apache Geode community <http://geode.incubator.apache.org/community/> - Learn how you can become a project contributor to this powerful in-memory, distributed database in this video <http://bit.ly/POSH0068yt> - Join this webinar <http://connect.pivotal.io/OSS_Webinar_9AMPOSH_Handson_Virtual_Meetup_Apache_Geode1_GettingStarted_Register.html> on June 2nd for a technical tutorial demonstrating how to use in-memory data grid technologies and add these capabilities to your applications
Want more? Come see Pivotal in action at a Pivotal Big Data Roadshow <http://www.pivotal.io/big-data/data-roadshow> or Pivotal Cloud Platform Roadshow <http://pivotal.io/platform-as-a-service/cloud-platform-roadshow> near you.
We look forward to seeing you at our next event <https://pivotal.io/news-events>!
Sincerely, The Pivotal Team
